sentences.english: Suddenly the postman was a regular at the Hagadorn house.
sentences.chinese: 溘然，郵差成了艾米家的常客。

sentences.english: I may not be here next week.
sentences.chinese: 或許我下週就要溘然長逝了。

sentences.english: Passed as death, On Semi-live for.
sentences.chinese: 不如溘然逝，安用半活爲。

sentences.english: Martin Luther King Jr. died with no more than one half of his dreams fulfilled.
sentences.chinese: 馬丁路德金帶着僅完成一半的夢想溘然辭世。

sentences.english: Laura burst into tears and ran out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 勞拉溘然哭了起來，然後從屋子裏跑了出去。

sentences.english: She strained herself to a final burst of speed.
sentences.chinese: 她傾全力溘然加速作最後衝刺。

sentences.english: I do not know what to say, I just suddenly miss you at this moment.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道該說什麼，我只是在這一刻溘然好想你。

sentences.english: The face of all the world is changed, I think.
sentences.chinese: 全世界的面目，我想，溘然轉變了。

sentences.english: She lay down and, turning her face to the wall, passed away.
sentences.chinese: 她躺下，把臉轉向牆壁，便溘然長逝了。

definition: to die/to depart this life (euphemism)/same as 去世
lit. to fly on a crane to the Western Paradise/fig. to pass away (idiom)
to depart this life/to be no more
to leave one's mortal frame (idiom)/to die
to die/to depart from the world forever
to die/to depart this mortal coil
to live to the (ripe) age of
see 駕鶴西去|驾鹤西去[jia4 he4 xi1 qu4]
see 駕鶴西去|驾鹤西去[jia4 he4 xi1 qu4]
on one's deathbed/at the point of death
to become an immortal/(fig.) to die
